description: {"blocks":[{"key":"29svj","text":"This protocol describes the sample preparation and analysis of short chain fatty acids in human serum samples. Short chain fatty acids (SCFAs) - acetic acid, propionic acid, butyric acid, isobutyric acid, valeric acid, isovaleric acid and 2-isobutoxyacetic acid (internal standard) were derivitised using 3-nitrophenylhydrazine (3-NPH). The derivatives were analysed by liquid chromatography high-resolution mass spectrometry (LC-HRMS).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7np5o","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c4c73","text":"A targeted LC-MS method was developed to measure six different SCFAs, by utilising approaches adapted from different published methods. These included Dei Cas et al, 2020 who profiled short and medium chain fatty acids following derivatisation (Dei Cas et al, 2020), Liao et al, 2021 who profiled kynurenine metabolites, short chain fatty acids and bile acids in samples following NPH derivatisation, and Nagatomo et al, 2022 who developed a method for application to plasma and tissue from a mouse model to profile SCFAs. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3e5nd","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cts1p","text":"Short chain fatty acids were extracted from human serum using protein precipitation. Sample extracts were then derivatised alongside a calibration curve. Analysis of the derivatised samples was carried out by liquid chromatography high resolution mass spectrometry (LC-HRMS) in full scan negative mode on a ThermoScientific Exploris 240 Orbitrap. The amount of each analyte in each sample was calculated using linear regression of the peak area ratio of the analytes to the internal standard. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b8fuj","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c5sud","text":"Our developed method used only 50 Î¼L of serum with limits of detection of acetic acid at 1 ug/mL, 200 ng/mL for propionic acid and butyric, 20 ng/mL for isobutyric acid, isovaleric acid and valeric acid. Due to the low mass of the analytes in this method we used high resolution mass spectrometry in full scan mode as an alternative to triple quadrupole mass spectrometry which utilises fragmentation of analytes and multiple reaction monitoring. Sensitivity obtained using this HRMS method was found to be comparable to published literature. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"92r9g","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"jasi","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6qu0p","text":"Analytes","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":8}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2vh4","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2djm5","text":" {"blocks":[{"key":"b7acm","text":"Prepare derivatisation solution A: Acetonitrile:Water (50:50)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":34},{"style":"bold","offset":35,"length":26}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"esoda","text":"Add 10 mL of LC-MS grade water to a 28 mL glass vial labelled Acetonitrile:Water (50:50).","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cv3gq","text":"Add 10 mL of LC-MS grade Acetonitrile.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cp57l","text":"Mix thoroughly.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bhq6g","text":"Prepare derivatisation solution B: Acetonitrile:Water (50:50) + 7% pyridine","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":34},{"style":"bold","offset":35,"length":40}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d5s12","text":"Add 8.6 mL of LC-MS grade water to a 28 mL glass vial labelled Acetonitrile:Water (50:50) + 7% pyidine.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"68p1r","text":"Add 1.4 mL of LC-MS grade pyridine to give a 14% pyridine in water solution.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5tpgg","text":"Dilute with 10 mL of LC-MS grade Acetonitrile to give a Acetonitrile:Water (50:50) + 7% pyridine solution.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fd2j0","text":"Mix thoroughly.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"457g0","text":"Prepare derivatisation solution C: 50 mM 1-Ethyl-3(3dimethyl-aminopropyl)carbodiimide (EDC) + 7% pyridine.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":106}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8ntcp","text":"Using the PS-100 balance, an appropriate amount of EDC was weighed into a 7 mL glass vial. EDC is toxic and highly corrosive and so this was added to the 7 mL vial in the fume hood and transferred to the balance with the lid on the vial. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":91,"length":147}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f07t","text":"To this the correct amount of acetonitrile:water (50:50) + 7% pyridine was added to achieve a 50 mM EDC solution in 50:50 acetonitrile:water + 7% pyridine. EDC has a molecular weight (MW) of 155.24 g/mol and so 7.72 mg is used per mL. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":156,"length":79}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4hjrv","text":"Prepare derivatisation solution D: 50 mM 3-NPH (3-nitrophenylhydrazine)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":35}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5892n","text":"Using the PS-100 balance, an appropriate amount of 3-NPH was weighed into a 7 mL glass vial. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2tn6u","text":"To this the correct amount of acetonitrile:water (50:50) was added to achieve a 50 mM 3-NPH solution in 50:50 acetonitrile:water. 3-NPH has a MW of 189.60 g/mol and so 9.45 mg is used per mL. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":130,"length":62}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dfa9l","text":"Prepare quenching solution: water + 5% Formic Acid","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":27}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dd2tl","text":"Add   of LC-MS grade water to a 500 mL glass bottle.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":4,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"603rt","text":"Add   of LC-MS grade Formic Acid to the water.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":4,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"341ql","text":"Mix thoroughly.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"475","error":false,"guid":"73C68D60223411EE99B2BF6724023CF3","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":3}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"25","error":false,"guid":"77167BB0223411EE99B2BF6724023CF3","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}}}}
